channel.title: Tip for getting verified on Spotify
channel.description:
Hey y’all,
So, a lot of you in here are on Spotify, but a few of you aren’t verified. Meaning, you can’t change your profile photo or your bio.
The thing is, no matter how many links you post in the Spotify Artist app to get verified, the most important thing is posting your email on the sites you share.
I didn’t post my email on my SC before, and I still used the link to get verified. 2 months later and I still got no reply. Then, after talking with the Spotify artist help (realllly speedy replies!) they said it was absolutely necessary to share the email you used for your non-artist Spotify account on your sites.
I did this _literally_ five minutes ago, and I got verified two minutes later, no kidding.
Just a little tip. You guys can share your helpful hints too xD

item.title: Tip for getting verified on Spotify
item.dc:creator: anon73773654
item.description:
Right, that’s exactly how I felt. I emailed the Spotify guy about it and he said you can create an email you’re comfortable sharing publicly, create a normal Spotify account with that, and request access to your artist account using your new regular account. (lol that probably sounded confusing)

So yours could be like crystldawnmusic@gmail.com or something.

item.dc:creator: anon73773654
item.description:
Cool!

It doesn’t have to be the one you used to sign up for SoundCloud and other sites. It just had to be the one you used for Spotify (which could be the same in many cases).

I used a personal email to sign up for SC, which I did not want to share publicly. So I posted my music email, which is the same one I used for Spotify. It’s not like Spotify knows I have two different emails xD
